title: Interviewer Technique Assessment Schema
description: Structured framework for analyzing interviewer techniques and behaviors in investigative interviews

timestamp.description: Point in time during interview (seconds from start)

items.description: Methods used to demonstrate attention and understanding

count.description: Total number of this question type

meta.description: Metadata about the interview and analysis for identification and contextual understanding

interviewId.description: Unique identifier for the interview to enable cross-referencing and database tracking

analysisDate.description: Date when analysis was performed to track analytical timeline and version control

interviewDuration.description: Duration in seconds of the complete interview to assess pacing and technique distribution

interviewContext.description: Primary organizational context in which the interview was conducted to assess applicable standards and protocols

interviewSetting.description: Physical location and environment where interview took place to evaluate environmental influences

recordingType.description: Methods used to document the interview to assess data completeness and reliability

interviewerProfile.description: Information about the interviewer's identity presentation and authority claims

identificationMethod.description: How the interviewer identified themselves to the subject, affecting perceived authority and rapport

selfIdentified.description: Whether interviewer explicitly stated their name/role to establish transparency

identificationStatement.description: Exact wording used for self-identification to evaluate clarity and potential deception

organizationDisclosed.description: Whether interviewer revealed their organizational affiliation for transparency assessment

roleDisclosed.description: Whether interviewer explained their professional function to establish expectations

identificationAccuracy.description: Degree to which self-identification reflected actual identity/role to assess honesty

statement.description: What was said during identity evolution to document exact wording

implication.description: What this statement suggested about interviewer's identity/authority to assess impact

authorityPresentation.description: How interviewer established and projected authority during the interview

claimedAuthority.description: Whether interviewer explicitly or implicitly claimed power/authority to assess influence tactics

authorityType.description: Category of authority projected to evaluate basis of influence

statement.description: Exact wording of authority claim to assess directness and impact

impliedPower.description: What abilities/powers this claim suggested interviewer possessed to evaluate intimidation potential

items.description: Visual or behavioral cues that reinforced authority perception

demographicFactors.description: Observable demographic characteristics of interviewer that may influence dynamics

apparentGender.description: Perceived gender of interviewer to assess potential gender dynamics

apparentAgeRange.description: Estimated age range of interviewer to evaluate age-related dynamics

relevantDemographicFactors.description: Other demographic characteristics that may influence interview dynamics

interviewApproach.description: Overall strategy and theoretical framework guiding the interview

overallStrategy.description: Primary interview approach used to categorize the fundamental methodology

items.description: Recognized interview methodologies influencing technique selection

phaseId.description: Sequential identifier for interview phase to track progression

phaseLabel.description: Descriptive name for the interview phase based on its purpose

primaryObjective.description: Main goal interviewer appeared to pursue during this phase

questioningDensity.description: Questions per minute to assess interrogative pressure

dominantTechniques.description: Primary methods employed during this phase to identify technique clustering

phasePatterning.description: Analysis of how interview phases were structured and sequenced

identifiablePattern.description: Whether a recognizable structure exists in phase progression to assess planning

patternDescription.description: Explanation of the observed phase pattern to characterize strategy

cyclicalNature.description: Whether interview returned to previous phases to assess adaptability

adaptationToResistance.description: Whether phasing changed in response to subject resistance to evaluate responsiveness

questioningTechniques.description: Analysis of specific question types and patterns used by interviewer

questionTypes.description: Categorization and assessment of different question formats employed

allOf.description: Questions designed to elicit narrative responses without suggesting answers
Questions requiring specific, limited responses (often yes/no)

count.description: Total number of leading questions to assess potential bias

question.description: Exact wording of the question to assess formulation

leadingNature.description: How the question directs toward a particular answer to evaluate suggestiveness

leading.description: Questions that suggest or imply a desired answer

count.description: Total number of alternative questions to assess technique prevalence

question.description: Exact wording of the question to assess formulation

options.description: The choices presented within the alternative question to assess framing

alternative.description: Questions presenting multiple options while presupposing an admission

count.description: Total number of probing questions to assess depth of inquiry

question.description: Exact wording of the question to assess formulation

targetedDetail.description: Specific information being sought through probing to assess focus

probing.description: Follow-up questions seeking elaboration on previous responses

questionSequencing.description: Patterns in how questions were ordered and structured

funnelApproach.description: Whether questioning progressed from general to specific to assess strategic narrowing

circularQuestioning.description: Whether same topics were revisited multiple times to assess consistency checking

themeDevelopment.description: Whether questions built upon previous responses to develop narratives to assess integration

sequencingPattern.description: Description of the overall question sequencing strategy observed

questionReformulation.description: Analysis of how questions were rephrased or reframed

frequency.description: Number of times interviewer reformulated questions to assess persistence

originalQuestion.description: Initial formulation of the question to compare with reformulation

reformulatedQuestion.description: How the question was rephrased to assess modification strategy

reasonForReformulation.description: Apparent purpose for changing the question to understand intent

persuasionTechniques.description: Methods used to influence subject's willingness to provide information

statement.description: Exact wording used to minimize to assess approach

minimizationStrategy.description: How seriousness was downplayed to characterize technique

allOf.description: Techniques that downplay the seriousness of actions or consequences

statement.description: Exact wording used to maximize to assess approach

maximizationStrategy.description: How seriousness was emphasized to characterize technique

allOf.description: Techniques that emphasize seriousness or negative consequences

statement.description: Exact wording used in moral appeal to assess approach

appealType.description: What moral principle was invoked to characterize technique

allOf.description: Appeals to ethics, conscience, or value systems

statement.description: Exact wording used in identity appeal to assess approach

identityInvoked.description: What aspect of identity was referenced to characterize technique

allOf.description: Appeals to subject's self-image, roles, or identities

statement.description: Exact wording used to rationalize to assess approach

rationalizationOffered.description: What justification was provided to characterize technique

allOf.description: Offering justifications or explanations for subject's actions

statement.description: Exact wording used to imply consequences to assess approach

impliedOutcome.description: What consequence was suggested to characterize technique

allOf.description: Suggestions of outcomes without explicit statements

evidencePresentationStrategies.description: How information and evidence were revealed or referenced during interview

evidenceWithholding.description: Strategic delay in revealing known information

observed.description: Whether evidence was intentionally withheld to establish presence of strategy

duration.description: Seconds evidence was withheld to assess strategic patience

effectOnSubjectBehavior.description: How withholding affected subject's statements to evaluate impact

evidenceImplication.description: Suggesting possession of evidence without direct presentation

observed.description: Whether evidence was implied rather than shown to establish presence of strategy

frequency.description: Number of evidence implications to assess reliance on technique

statement.description: Exact wording used to imply evidence to assess approach

implicationStrength.description: How strongly evidence possession was implied to evaluate directness

subjectResponse.description: How subject reacted to the implication to assess effectiveness

directEvidencePresentation.description: Explicit sharing or description of evidence to subject

observed.description: Whether evidence was directly presented to establish presence of strategy

frequency.description: Number of direct evidence presentations to assess reliance on technique

evidenceType.description: Nature of evidence presented to categorize presentation

presentationMethod.description: How evidence was revealed to assess delivery technique

subjectResponse.description: How subject reacted to the presentation to assess effectiveness

strategicEvidence.description: Overall pattern of evidence use throughout interview

evidenceSequencing.description: Order in which evidence was presented to assess strategic planning

strengthProgression.description: Whether evidence was presented from weak to strong or vice versa to assess strategy

timedReleaseStrategy.description: Whether evidence release followed a deliberate timing pattern to assess planning

rapportStrategies.description: Techniques used to build and maintain relationship with subject

initialRapportEfforts.description: Techniques used early in interview to establish connection

observed.description: Whether initial rapport building was attempted to establish presence

duration.description: Seconds spent on initial rapport to assess prioritization

technique.description: Method used to maintain rapport to categorize approach

statement.description: Exact wording used for rapport maintenance to assess approach

allOf.description: Techniques used throughout interview to sustain relationship

selfDisclosure.description: Interviewer sharing personal information to build connection

observed.description: Whether interviewer self-disclosure occurred to establish presence

frequency.description: Number of self-disclosures to assess reliance on technique

items.description: Types of information interviewer revealed about themselves

disclosure.description: What personal information was shared to assess nature

purpose.description: Apparent reason for disclosure to evaluate strategic intent

activeListening.description: Demonstrating attention and understanding of subject's statements

observed.description: Whether active listening techniques were used to establish presence

frequency.description: Number of active listening demonstrations to assess consistency

linguisticStrategies.description: Analysis of language use and adaptation by interviewer

registerAdaptation.description: Changes in formality or style of language to match subject

observed.description: Whether register adaptation occurred to establish presence

adaptationPattern.description: How language style changed over time to characterize evolution

matchingSubjectLanguage.description: Whether interviewer mirrored subject's language to assess convergence

shift.description: How language register changed to document adaptation

apparentPurpose.description: Why register appears to have shifted to assess intent

lexicalChoices.description: Specific word selection patterns and strategies

technicalVocabulary.description: Whether specialized terminology was used to assess expertise projection

euphemisms.description: Whether indirect language was used for sensitive topics to assess softening

labelingBehavior.description: Whether interviewer applied characterizing terms to subject's actions to assess framing

term.description: Specific word used with strategic significance

frequency.description: How often term was used to assess emphasis

apparentPurpose.description: Why term appears to have been chosen to evaluate intent

pronoun.description: Strategic use of personal pronouns to influence relationship

firstPersonPlural.description: Use of 'we' to create alliance or shared perspective

secondPersonEmphasis.description: Frequent use of 'you' for direct attribution or focus

depersonalization.description: Use of third-person references for psychological distancing

significantPatterns.description: Notable patterns in pronoun usage to document strategy

sentenceStructure.description: Patterns in grammatical construction of statements

dominantStructure.description: Most common sentence construction to assess communication style

directness.description: Degree of straightforwardness in communication to assess approach

significantPatterns.description: Notable patterns in sentence construction to document strategy

psychologicalManipulation.description: Techniques that leverage cognitive or emotional vulnerabilities

cognitiveBiasExploitation.description: Using known mental shortcuts or biases to influence responses

observed.description: Whether cognitive bias exploitation occurred to establish presence

emotionalManipulation.description: Deliberately arousing or leveraging emotions to influence responses

observed.description: Whether emotional manipulation occurred to establish presence

technique.description: What emotional lever was used to categorize approach

statement.description: Exact wording used to manipulate emotion to assess approach

targetEmotion.description: What feeling was intended to be aroused to evaluate intent

socialPressure.description: Using group norms or external expectations to influence compliance

observed.description: Whether social pressure techniques were used to establish presence

legalConsiderations.description: Elements affecting admissibility and ethical compliance of interview

rightsCommunication.description: How legal rights were conveyed to subject if applicable

observed.description: Whether any rights were communicated to establish presence

clarity.description: How understandably rights were explained to assess adequacy

comprehensionCheck.description: Whether understanding of rights was verified to assess thoroughness

voluntarinessProtections.description: Elements affecting freedom of choice in participation

freedomToLeaveIndicated.description: Whether subject was informed they could terminate interview to assess coercion

statement.description: Exact wording of potentially coercive statement to assess nature

coercionType.description: What form of pressure was applied to categorize concern

statement.description: Exact wording of deceptive statement to assess nature

deceptionType.description: What form of deception was used to categorize concern

promisesThreats.description: Statements suggesting outcomes contingent on cooperation

statement.description: Exact wording of promise to assess nature

promiseType.description: What benefit was offered to categorize inducement

legalConcern.description: Potential admissibility issue created by promise

statement.description: Exact wording suggesting benefit to assess nature

implication.description: What benefit was suggested to categorize inducement

legalConcern.description: Potential admissibility issue created by implication

statement.description: Exact wording of threat to assess nature

threatType.description: What consequence was threatened to categorize pressure

legalConcern.description: Potential admissibility issue created by threat

statement.description: Exact wording suggesting consequence to assess nature

implication.description: What consequence was suggested to categorize pressure

legalConcern.description: Potential admissibility issue created by implication

effectivenessAssessment.description: Evaluation of technique impact and overall interviewer success

pivotalMoments.description: Critical turning points that significantly impacted interview outcome

technique.description: What approach created the breakthrough to identify successful methods

impact.description: How this moment changed interview trajectory to assess significance

technique.description: Specific interviewer approach to be evaluated

keyInsight.description: Critical observation about this technique's application to document learning

adaptabilityAssessment.description: Evaluation of interviewer's responsiveness to subject

recognizedResistance.description: Whether interviewer identified and acknowledged subject resistance to assess awareness

adaptedTechniques.description: Whether interviewer changed approaches in response to resistance to assess flexibility

timeliness.description: How quickly interviewer adjusted to changing conditions to assess responsiveness

appropriateness.description: Whether technique adaptations were well-suited to circumstances to assess judgment
